intro: [WRONG START] parablechnum lechleri, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and is renowned for its latex-producing capabilities. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Its latex has been historically used for producing natural rubber. However, due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it faces threats in the wild.
